summary: Internal FBI email chain regarding approval of documents for a briefing about the Epstein case, including an RSVP questionnaire and draft email language. The email discusses modifications to security language for a briefing to be held in a federal building.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.context: Sender of the initial email attaching documents for review and approval regarding an Epstein-related briefing.

events.title: FBI internal email exchange on Epstein briefing documents
events.description: Internal FBI email correspondence forwarding documents for approval related to an upcoming briefing on the Epstein case, including an RSVP questionnaire and draft email language.

keyFacts: The FBI was planning a briefing related to the Epstein case in October 2019.
The briefing required security protocols because it was to be held in a federal building.
Documents included an RSVP questionnaire and draft email language that needed approval from NY (likely New York FBI office).
The email shows internal FBI coordination on victim services division activities related to Epstein.
The document contains standard FBI confidentiality notices about protecting sensitive information.
